short_summary: Development of international standards for critical minerals
description: The Department of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) is supporting the administration of Canadian participation and leadership in the development of various international standards related to critical minerals, including through the relevant Canadian Mirror Committees to International Standards Organization (ISO) Technical Committee (TC) 298 (Rare Earths), TC 333 (Lithium), TC 345 (Specialty Metals and Minerals), and Project Committee (PC) 348 (Sustainable Raw Materials), with the objective of eventual adoption of relevant standards into Canada’s national standards system.

### Title
D-EVS / Norme ISO et Minéraux Critiques
================


### Procurement Information


* Reference Number: cb-892-68911972
* Solicitation Number: NRCan - 5000082410
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-07-15 14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-07-19
* Expected Contract End Date: 2027-03-31


### Description


The Natural Resources Canada is soliciting for contractors to develop standards for critical minerals through the International Organization for Standardization (ISO). The objective is for these standards to be adopted domestically in Canada's national standard system.


### Description of Work

The Contractor will be responsible for providing leadership and management on various ISO Committees related to critical minerals, including:

* Providing ISO procedural guidance and project management
* Leading interactions with the Standards Council of Canada (SCC) and the ISO Secretariat
* Providing support to Canadian Mirror Committees and members
* Developing and maintaining necessary documentation
* Recruiting and mentoring Canadian experts for the mirror committees
* Administering meetings and events, including logistics and coordination

Specifically, the Contractor will engage existing Canadian Mirror Committees (TC 298, TC 333, TC 345, and PC 348) and support one-year incremental work for hosting a lithium plenary session in 2025. Additionally, the Contractor will build and maintain capacity for Canadian experts to participate in new mirror committees.

### Additional Information
Approved participants are encouraged from the diversity of Canada, including minority-owned businesses. Suppliers interested in this opportunity are encouraged to submit an expression of interest or proposal.
